results.title: Don't just stand there coughing
results.creator_credit: Craig Lahiff, Gus Howard, South Australian Film Corporation and Seethru Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film is designed to show the causes and effects of air pollution. It offers possible remedies to improve the quality of the air we breathe. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Don't Be Scalped
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
In this 1960 film, we see female machine operators working in factories. The film focuses on a woman named Judy, describing her outfit and the dangers associated with wearing high-heeled shoes, full skirts, jewellery and long hair while operating a machine. The film then shows Judy dressed in the correct clothing options, including protective shoes, coveralls and cap to cover her hair. It also gives advice on how to lift heavy objects. As opposed to the safety films directed at male workers, the narrator focuses on physical appearance throughout the film, describing Judy as attractive, charming and pretty, and warning against fatigue, wear on clothing, disfigurement and scalping.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Don't eat the pictures
results.brief_description: This zany musical follows the adventures of Big Bird, Smiffy, Cookie Monster and the rest of the Sesame Street gang as they find themselves accidentally locked in the Metro Museum overnight. Featuring cameo appearances by James Mason, Fritz Weaver and Paul Dooley.

results.title: Don't be sawed
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1961 film demonstrates the regulations for circular saws in industry, with footage of workers and machines in factories. The instructional narration describes the hazards associated with circular saws and the requirements for guards and safety equipment, warning of the dangers of faulty or unprotected equipment. Alongside the didactic instruction, the film contains melodramatic footage of fingers covered in fake blood and a man pretending to be impaled with a stake of wood.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Don't be incorrectly dressed
results.creator_credit: Ron Collins, Stan Murdoch, Reg Perier and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1962 film demonstrates the need for various types of protective clothing and equipment when working with abrasives, welding, lead and chemicals. Accompanied by an instructional narration, the film shows footage of workers in various industries, and the need for protective glasses, face shields, respirators, gloves, footwear and clothing.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

There are several jumps in the soundtrack throughout the film due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Don't be cut up
results.creator_credit: Joan Hansen, R.D. Hansen, Fortune Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1959 film outlines the hazards associated with the metal trade industry. It emphasises the importance of fixed guards on machines including guillotines, bending brakes, power presses and emery wheels. The film is interspersed with title cards including the repeated ‘Accidents need not happen’ and features a voiceover narration dramatically warning against accidents. It is directed at both workers in the factory risking accident and disability, and employers risking loss of production and financial loss.

Produced by Fortune Film Productions and the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Don't be a fall guy
results.creator_credit: Ron Collins, Stan Murdoch, Reg Perier and New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry
results.brief_description:
This 1962 instructional film demonstrates safety regulations on building sites in Sydney, New South Wales. Narrated by a didactic voiceover, the film dramatises the do’s and dont’s of construction sites, including good housekeeping, adequate lighting, head protection, guard rails, proper scaffolding and safety lines. It emphasises the risks of carelessness and overconfidence of builders working without proper safety equipment.

In order to demonstrate this, the film restages several accidents, including a man falling down an open lift shaft after the guard rail was removed by a fellow builder. The film also includes footage of riggers climbing steel frames on multi-story buildings without safety harnesses, in what would have been standard practice in this era.

Produced by the New South Wales Department of Labour and Industry.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Perfect strangers
results.creator_credit: Stephen Poliakoff, John Chapman and BBC
results.brief_description: A drama with family, immigration and belonging the main themes. With a dreamy and slow atmosphere, this family history story unfolds with the use of family photographs as story telling tools. It’s a moving series about relationships and ancestors, history and reunion. Cast includes Michael Gambon and Lindsay Duncan.

results.title: Dominators: Smith, Hayes, Cummings (S)
results.brief_description: Bart Cummings, Colin Hayes and Tommy Smith, Australia’s legendary trio of racehorse trainers. Their notoriety extends beyond the profession they have dominated for decades. Each of them possess a natural affinity with the horse: individually gifted with that enigmatic sixth sense. Record breaking achievements distinguish them from their contemporaries by the length of the Flemington straight. Their amazing winning formula applies not to hundreds of races, but thousands. Between them they’ve won 73 Derbies, 50 Oaks, 11 Cox Plates, 13 Melbourne Cups and 11 Golden Slippers. This is their success story.

results.title: Make Believe Play (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School Series No.4”.
Shows children’s play with paint, crayons, scrap, collage and dressing-up materials, that involves children in making and pretending. It shows the development from spontaneous play to a structured play situation
